channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: What happens if a coronavirus vaccine is never developed? It has happened before
item.description: As countries lie frozen in lockdown and billions of people lose their livelihoods, public figures are teasing a breakthrough that would mark the end of the crippling coronavirus pandemic: a vaccine.

item.title: Boris Johnson says 'arrangements' for his death were made when he was in hospital with coronavirus
Pandemic experts issue sobering warning about future
item.description: Pandemic experts John Barry and Marc Lipsitch co-authored a new report predicting that the coronavirus pandemic could last up to two more years. They're warning that things could get "considerably worse than what we've seen so far."

item.title: How Trump has broken the polls
What you need to know about coronavirus today
item.description: Expect a barrage of reopening announcements in the coming days.

item.title: Gunfire exchanged in DMZ across border between North and South Korea
item.description: North Korea fired gunshots at the wall of a South Korean guard post in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ), a buffer area which separates the two countries, on Sunday, and the South fired back, according to its military.

item.title: What Kim Yo Jong's rise to the top says -- and doesn't say -- about being a woman in North Korea
The world is paying a high price for cheap clothes
item.description: When shoppers entered H&M's flagship store in central London last summer, the first thing they would have seen was a dark blue, flowery minidress hanging front and center. On sale for just £4 (or $4.80 US), the dress featured more than a low price tag. It also boasted a green label with the word "CONSCIOUS."

item.title: Russia adds over 10,000 cases in another record single-day increase
item.description: Russia reported 10,633 new cases of the coronavirus in another record single-day increase Sunday, bringing the total number to 134,687.

item.title: US Air Force sends B-1 bombers back to Guam on temporary deployment
item.description: Just a few weeks after the US Air Force ended its 16-year Continuous Bomber Presence in Guam, its B-1 bombers are back on the Pacific island. The temporary deployment program is designed to keep Washington's adversaries guessing about what US firepower will be where and when.

item.title: Engineers, chefs and waitresses now farming in UK
item.description: • Doctors warn of second wave in US

item.title: Hear meat worker's message to Trump after 4,900 test positive
item.description: Over 4,900 meat and poultry plant workers tested positive for coronavirus in the US, according to the CDC. CNN's Miguel Marquez speaks to a worker at a Tyson plant in Nebraska.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
The computer virus that cost the world $10 billion
He came home from hospital to die. His son found a way to keep him alive
item.description: When Suryakant "Suri" Nathwani returned from the hospital, the reserved 81-year-old grabbed his son's hand and pleaded to be allowed to die at home. "He said, 'Please promise me one thing: If I'm going to go, I'm going to go here. Do not take me back there,'" his son Raj Nathwani said.

item.title: After 7 weeks of lockdown, Spaniards can finally exercise outdoors
item.description: At 6 a.m. local time in Spain, people who have been cooped up in their homes for seven weeks emerged into the early morning light to run, cycle or walk after Europe's strictest coronavirus lockdown restrictions were slightly eased.

item.title: City on the edge: 'If your child is hungry, you will eat your rulers to feed your children'
Boris Johnson names son after doctors who saved his life
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his fiancee Carrie Symonds have named their newborn son Wilfred Lawrie Nicholas Johnson, it was announced on Saturday.

item.title: Princess Charlotte photos released to mark her fifth birthday
item.description: The UK royal family has released new photos of Princess Charlotte, the daughter of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, delivering food to the vulnerable to mark her fifth birthday.

item.title: At least 46 people killed in prison riot in Venezuela
item.description: At least 46 people have died in a riot at the Los Llanos Penitentiary in the Venezuelan state of Portuguesa, according to an opposition lawmaker from the area.

item.title: Italy's incredible 'floating ship' bridge reaches for the sky
item.description: High above the Polcevera valley, the final section of a majestic new bridge was hoisted into place this week, signaling the imminent completion of a remarkable engineering project against seemingly impossible odds.

item.title: Man arrested for camping at Disney island told police he didn't know he was trespassing and thought it was a 'tropical paradise'
item.description: A man arrested for camping at Walt Disney World's Discovery Island told police he didn't know he was trespassing on what looked to him like a "tropical paradise," police said.

item.title: The 'tsunami' of airline job losses has begun in Europe. US carriers could be next.
Greta Thunberg is donating $100,000 to help children affected by coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Climate activist Greta Thunberg is donating prize money she won to help fight the coronavirus pandemic and protect children from its potentially detrimental consequences.

item.title: Reporter to Trump's new press secretary: Will you ever lie to us?
item.description: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany tells reporters at her first press briefing that she will never lie to the press.

item.title: What Asian nations know about squashing Covid
item.description: The number of Americans who have died from Covid-19 now significantly exceeds the total US troop fatalities during the Vietnam War.

item.title: This CEO is giving $1.6M he made in the stock market to his employees
item.description: Larry Connor, CEO of the Connor Group, made a lot of money on the stock market in just 8 days. He's giving it all away to about 400 employees.

item.title: Invasive giant hornets have been spotted in the US for the first time
item.description: Just when you thought 2020 could not get any worse, there are giant hornets with a venomous sting to add to the list of worries this year.

item.title: Hafthor Bjornsson, 'Game of Thrones' star, sets a record by deadlifting 1,104 pounds
item.description: Hafþór Björnsson, best known for playing the Mountain in the popular HBO series "Game of Thrones," just broke a major world record.

item.title: What we can learn from South Korea about containing Covid-19
item.description: What can the world learn from South Korea, considered by health experts to be one of the few countries that did most things right in containing the spread of coronavirus? CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: Russia said virus was under control. See startling images that emerged.
item.description: Startling images from a hospital in the south of Russia show how Covid-19 is overstretching its health service. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

item.title: Bill Gates says US system produces 'bogus' testing numbers
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta talk to Bill Gates on the fight against coronavirus.

item.title: How a travel photographer in self-quarantine 'escaped' her apartment. You can do it, too
item.description: Los Angeles-based photographer Erin Sullivan has found an unconventional way to satiate her penchant for exploration while under a stay-at-home order because of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Three pole vaulters will compete in their own backyards
item.description: If you can't bring the pole vault to the stadium, bring it to the backyard?

item.title: Queen's 'We Are The Champions' reimagined for health care workers
item.description: Almost everyone knows the lyrics to Queen's "We Are the Champions." Now, the band has turned the song on its head, as a tribute to workers on the frontline fighting coronavirus.

item.title: Watch hilarious talking dog meme about quarantine
item.description: Dog-owners go gaga over their pets while in quarantine. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports they're social but not distancing.

item.title: Photos: With cities on lockdown, animals are finding more room to roam
Rarely seen photos from the Met Gala show celebrities letting loose
item.description: The first Monday of May this year marks an absence in the fashion world. With the cancellation of the Met Gala and the indefinite closure of the Metropolitan Museum of Art due to the coronavirus pandemic, the museum's front steps will remain quiet, empty of the usual crowds of celebrities and fashion insiders who flock to the annual fundraiser for the Costume Institute.

item.title: All that sourdough you've been making could help scientists
item.description: By the end of this pandemic, we'll all have one thing in common -- at some point during our isolation, we attempted to make sourdough.

item.title: 'Parks and Rec' reunion channeled all of us in quarantine
item.description: The cast members of NBC's hit sitcom "Parks and Recreation" came together for a special reunion show in hopes of raising money for Feeding America.

item.title: Why the pressure to change our faces has never been higher
item.description: For her sprawling history "Face: A Visual Odyssey," designer and author Jessica Helfand assembled a dazzling cabinet of human curiosities. From police mugshots and dating-site selfies, to politicians' headshots, Victorian death portraits and rubberised sex-dolls -- all to grapple with the way our faces have been presented and judged over the centuries -- and the lengths we've gone to, to "improve" them.

item.title: What's in store for the cruise industry?
item.description: When travelers come aboard the Zaandam, a cruise ship in the Holland America Line, they have access to nine levels of elegant lodgings, entertainment and fine dining.

item.title: Is this the end of cheap air travel?
item.description: Alexandre de Juniac of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) says the coronavirus pandemic will end the days of cheap flights.

item.title: Birx said Michigan protests were 'devastatingly worrisome'
How Trump has broken the polls
item.description: Poll of the week: A new Ipsos/Reuters poll finds that former Vice President Joe Biden leads President Donald Trump by a 45% to 39% margin.

item.title: Trump administration all-in on reopening America
item.description: Gone were the daily White House briefings with Vice President Mike Pence solemnly urging Americans to shelter at home to stop the spread of Covid-19 and governors to follow a slowly phased-in reopening plan. The 45 days of federally recommended social distancing ended Thursday. Now the Trump administration was all-in on reopening America.

item.title: What you need to know about coronavirus today
item.description: Expect a barrage of reopening announcements in the coming days.

item.title: Biden confronts allegation as he prepares for unprecedented campaign against Trump
item.description: Six months before Election Day, Joe Biden is scrambling to build a campaign to wage a political fight with little precedent in American history, hoping to capitalize on opportunities and overcome challenges that the coronavirus crisis has injected into his battle with President Donald Trump.

item.title: Alligator found impaled with two arrows in its side. Now there's a hunt for the suspect.
item.description: A Crime Stoppers group in Florida is asking the public for help after someone discovered an injured alligator with two arrows impaled in its side.

item.title: What the rise of Kim Jong Il's youngest child says about being a woman in North Korea
item.description: • Picture of Kim at fertilizer plant seems legitimate, US official says
